intro: Gorceixia, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Gorceixia has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fruit-like structures called follicles. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
